Question_1.Context: The study entailed the development of a visual and tactile perception technique for braille character recognition. In the visual perception approach, a deep learning model was used based on custom-made braille dataset collected through data augmentation and preprocessing.
Question_1.Question: What was the performance indicated by mAP50 and mAP75 on the generated dataset?
Question_1.Source: The attained performance was indicated by an mAP50 of 94.8 and mAP75 of 70.4 on the generated dataset.

Question_2.Context: Visual perception techniques have enabled object detection, segmentation, and classification due to the advancement of graphics processing units (GPUs) for parallel computing and high-quality datasets.
Question_2.Question: What has enabled object detection, segmentation, and classification in visual perception techniques?
Question_2.Source: Visual perception techniques have enabled object detection, segmentation, and classification because of the advancement of graphics processing units (GPUs) for parallel computing and high-quality datasets.

Question_3.Context: Tactile perception techniques overcome environmental constraints and require specific conditions, including small size, high density, and high sensitivity.
Question_3.Question: What specific conditions are required for tactile perception techniques?
Question_3.B: Small size, low density, and low sensitivity
Question_3.C: Small size, high density, and high sensitivity
Question_3.Source: Tactile perception techniques are not only limited by slower data processing rates but also require specific conditions, including small size, high density, and high sensitivity.

Question_4.Context: The study utilized a transfer learning model, Faster R-CNN–FPN–ResNet-50, for object detection in the visual perception approach.
Question_4.Question: Which transfer learning model was utilized for object detection in the visual perception approach?
Question_4.Source: The study utilized the transfer learning model, namely, Faster R-CNN–FPN–ResNet-50, for object detection.

Question_5.Context: The tactile perception technique utilized a capacitive sensing approach with a micropatterned pressure-sensitive layer to enhance sensitivity and response/recovery time.
Question_5.Question: What approach was utilized in the tactile perception technique to enhance sensitivity and response/recovery time?
Question_5.Source: In this study, a capacitive sensing approach was utilized with a micropatterned pressure-sensitive layer to enhance sensitivity and response/recovery time.

Question_6.Context: Pressure sensors are transducers that convert applied pressure into changes in electrical signals.
Question_6.Question: What do pressure sensors convert applied pressure into?
Question_6.Source: Pressure sensors are transducers that convert applied pressure into changes in electrical signals.

Question_7.Context: The study fabricated a capacitive pressure sensor array with a parallel-plate capacitor structure comprising a plane electrode at the top and interdigitated electrodes at the bottom.
Question_7.Question: What structure did the capacitive pressure sensor array comprise of?
Question_7.Source: The study fabricated a capacitive pressure sensor array with a parallel-plate capacitor structure comprising a plane electrode at the top and interdigitated electrodes at the bottom.

Question_8.Context: The pressure sensor with the dome structure exhibited an eightfold improvement in performance compared with the pressure sensor with the blank film.
Question_8.Question: How much improvement in performance was exhibited by the pressure sensor with the dome structure compared to the one with the blank film?
Question_8.Source: The pressure sensor with the dome structure exhibited an eightfold improvement in performance compared with the pressure sensor with the blank film.

Question_9.Context: The pressure sensing performance was conducted under flat conditions and measured using an LCR meter.
Question_9.Question: What was used to measure the pressure sensing performance?
Question_9.Source: The pressure sensing performance was conducted under flat conditions and measured using an LCR meter.

Question_10.Context: The proposed braille recognition technique based on vision and tactile exhibited complementary characteristics.
Question_10.Question: What characteristics did the proposed braille recognition technique based on vision and tactile exhibit?
Question_10.Source: The proposed braille recognition technique based on vision and tactile exhibited complementary characteristics.
